projects.description: The "Female Afghan Teacher Training" project delivers free, blended professional training across multiple disciplines, including classroom management, curriculum design, communication with children, and child protection. projects.name: Increasing self-reliance of the EQ-affected youth and adolescents through TVET upskilling
projects.description: Implemented in 2024, this project aimed to increase the self-reliance of earthquake-affected youth and adolescents through Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) upskilling. It consisted of three main components: business start-up support, a youth summer camp, and training on post-disaster recovery and emergency response planning. Through these activities, the project enhanced entrepreneurial, vocational, and resilience skills among young people and education personnel.
projects.outcome: Affected populations are assisted to overcome disaster impact through emergency response and targeted recovery initiatives.

projects.name: Develop and pilot assessment tools on evaluation of harm reduction programmes and conduct surveys on HIV in Iran
projects.description:
The present sub-output comprises several activities:
a. conducting harm reduction process evaluation (2024) b. Comparative evaluation of buprenorphine and methadone maintenance therapy in prison settings (2024- 2025) c. HIV behavioural survey in prisons in Iran

projects.name: Capacity enhancement for government on climate action
projects.description:
Through cooperation with Swedish International Water Institute (SIWI) and MoEng, the WASH-Bottleneck Analysis Tool ( WASH-BAT) is introduced to WASH sector and exercised, including recommendations to improve WASH sector with a climate change lens. Some of prioritized recommendations are subsequently supported to be implemented.

projects.name: Solar-powered infrastructure in vulnerable communities to enhance energy resilience is implemented
projects.description: In 2023, the first phase of the project established two solar power plants: one with a capacity of 192 kWp in Saveh refugee settlement and another with 52 kWp in Torbat-e Jam refugee settlement. The second phase, initiated in June 2024, involves expanding the Torbat-e Jam plant to 200 kWp and installing a new 200 kWp solar power plant in Semnan refugee settlement. The expansion phase in Torbat-e Jam settlement was successfully completed in July 2025, increasing the capacity to 200 kWp. Another s

projects.name: The impact of climate change on the Qanats registered in the UNESCO World Heritage List in Iran is investigated and its management plan updated.
projects.description: In collaboration with ICQHS UNESCO Category II Centre, the impact of Climate Change on the Qanats Registered as UNESCO World Heritage List in Iran is investigated and the piloted Qanats management plan will be updated based on the result of the assessment. The damages to the qanats due to climate change is categorized in three types including physical, natural, and human-induced damages.
